result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:16 PM Judge Anthony Stella Jr. appears by video from the Iron County Courthouse. Defendant Randy Lee Ross appeared by video.  Attorney Renee M Taber appeared by video for Randy Lee Ross.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court reviews court record and the Speedy Trial Demand. Attny Taber acknowledges information, waives reading. DEF stands mute to all counts, Court enters NG Plea to all counts. Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial. Court schedules 1 Day Speedy Trial per document filed. Attys to contact the JA on Final Pre-Trial Date.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for January 25, 2023 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 25, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on January 25, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on January 25, 2023 at 08:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Speedy Trial
Defendant's Jury Instructions
Defendant's Motion in Limine

10:19 AM Defendant Randy Lee Ross in court, from the Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Renee M Taber in court for Randy Lee Ross.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Def Atty Renee Taber indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing. DEF State calls witness Deputy Casey Culhane, sworn in by Clerk. State request the Court to take notice of Case 21CF359 and the Count involved. Atty Taber has no objection. Court takes judicial notice. State begins examination. 10:38 AM Witness identified the DEF, Court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination. 10:46 AM Cross-Examination by Attorney Taber. 10:51 AM Attny Taber no further questions. 10:51 AM Witness examination ends with no further questions. No additional comment from either party. Court addresses preliminary findings. Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial. Court schedules Arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Arraignment on October 24, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Preliminary hearing on September 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

(with Judge Stella's Zoom Information)

9:10 AM Judge Anthony Stella appears by video from the Iron County Courthouse. Defendant Randy Lee Ross appeared by video from the Barron County Jail. Attorney Renee M Taber appeared by video for Randy Lee Ross.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court reviews court record and bond. Def Atty has had opportunity to review amended criminal complaint. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint DEF wishes to have preliminary hearing within time limits. Def Atty states DEF Atty requests that the DEF be transferred to the Sawyer County Jail and requests for a Writ for Produce/Transport be filed by the State prior to Preliminary Hearing. Court schedules the Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Hearing on August 23, 2023 at 01:45 pm.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
